content: The @WG-prioritization will be doing pre-triage in this channel.
We won’t have as much work now that we prioritize issues async :slight_smile:
Here #t-compiler > weekly meeting 2020-04-23 #54818 we have a link to where the weekly meeting is going to happen
Create Agenda

Create a hackmd document with the agenda for the Triage Meeting.
Here is the meeting template.
doing that
Meeting agenda
maybe we could move to pre-meeting agendas xD
Let’s have a pre-pre-meeting to prepare the pre-meeting agenda :laughing:

DPC said:

maybe we could move to pre-meeting agendas xD

I wouldn't because part of the process we do here is just building the agenda :)
this first step is just clicking the create button
anyway, let's get this started
ah i see it now :slight_smile: nevermind
Remove leftovers

1. Unnominate leftover I-nominated
    - Remove I-nominated tag from issues discussed on the last meeting.
this could probably be done async
and it's a task that is a pain to do to be honest :)
but we don't want to keep things nominated that are already discussed so we must do it, it's just that async would probably be better
anyway ...
this were our last week nominations

• [ ] "[WIP] Rename mir::Rvalue to Op." #70928
    • In FCP, disposition to close.
  • [ ] "Should enum discriminants have generics in scope?" #70453
    • In FCP, disposition to merge.
  • [ ] "Add support for parsing with rust-analyzer instead of librustc_parse #70761" #70761
    • Nominated for discussion, maybe needs an MCP.
#70928 is again in the list and I'm pretty sure we don't want to discuss that :)
#70453 is also again in the list
#70761 is not

Santiago Pastorino said:

but we don't want to keep things nominated that are already discussed so we must do it, it's just that async would probably be better

obviously it would be ideal if I learned to unnominate issues during the meeting itself, but I'm usually so focused on driving the meeting forward that I don't do it
so, I'd just check last meeting's discussion just in case to see what do we want to do with those that keep nominated
(but a bot to assist the meeting could help with this, right?)

pnkfelix said:

Santiago Pastorino said:

but we don't want to keep things nominated that are already discussed so we must do it, it's just that async would probably be better

obviously it would be ideal if I learned to unnominate issues during the meeting itself, but I'm usually so focused on driving the meeting forward that I don't do it

yes, this makes sense, it happens the same to me :)

(but a bot to assist the meeting could help with this, right?)

:rolling_eyes:
maybe just for the sake of clarity and for now, meanwhile we don't have a bot, what if after finishing the discussion you say @WG-prioritization please unnominate this one
like pretend the wg is the bot and accept unimplemented requests :)
Or have a slave to do so
as long as the request is not bake a cake for your kids, we would be fine I think :P
I could totally bake a cake, the problem would be shipping it to US
on the topic of #70928 itself
There is ongoing discussion on that PR of what names we might actually choose for a renaming
the PR itself will not land as is
so my meta-question is: Is github the right place for that kind of bikeshedding discussion?
If so, then I guess the status quo is fine (with the discussion going on there)
(and we may want to still mention PR #70928 at the meeting itself, just to remind people that a discussion is ongoing)
ok, let me re-nominate with that clear purpose then.
but if github is not the right place to be having that bikeshed discussion
I guess we could also create a topic on zulip but the nomination and mentioning it during the meeting would be ok too
then someone (us? T-Compiler? someone else?) should figure out the right venue for that discussion, and we should close that PR tout suite tout de suite
yeah I don't know what would be best
It doesn't seem worth a design meeting
maybe Zulip is indeed the answer.
let's mention it tomorrow and see, I guess @eddyb was one of the interested ones so my guess is he will try to have that discussion
yes, okay, maybe make the plan be to mention PR #70928 in the meeting tomorrow, and explicitly suggest that the discussion there be migrated to zulip at that time
so that we can close the PR (with a link to the ongoing discussion) and move on with our lives
(another option, I just realized, would be to allocate a Major Change Proposal Issue for this...)
(but lets debate that at tomorrow's meeting.)
:+1:, that section is done then
and above all, try to limit the actual discussion of PR #70928 in the meeting itself tomorrow. :slight_smile:
Most importantly, did you mean tout de suite? x)

1. Remove leftover I-prioritize
    - Remove I-prioritize tag from already prioritized issues.
that's empty
Unprioritized I-prioritize
Go over unprioritized I-prioritize issues. We should also go over I-nominated meanwhile we migrate, we were using I-nominated sometimes as an implicit request for prioritization.

1. No team assigned and No team assigned I-nominated
    - Add T-compiler tag when it corresponds.
both empty as expected
awesome

1. T-compiler and T-compiler I-nominated
    - Prioritize issues and remove nomination of the ones not worth discussing.
    - Tag regressions accordingly.
    - Ping appropriate people and/or ICE-breakers.
there are two nominated
ok but unrelated to prioritization
although both issues are unprioritized but there's no request for prioritization either
let's move on

1. All teams and All teams I-nominated
    - No action required. It's nice to look at this for comparison.
ok nothing to do there either
just in case and for clarification
all these lists shouldn't have I-nominated search, I left those just in case meanwhile we were migrating to I-prioritize people were still using I-nominated
but I guess it's time to remove that and in any case those will be catched when we review nominations
done then
Regressions

1. Beta regressions without P-label
    - Prioritize.
    - Ping appropriate people and/or ICE-breakers.
    - Assign if possible; if it remains unassigned, add it to agenda so we can assign during the meeting.
empty

1. Nightly regressions without P-label
    - Prioritize.
    - Ping appropriate people and/or ICE-breakers.
    - Assign if possible; if it remains unassigned, add it to agenda so we can assign during the meeting.
there's one and it's not prioritized
#71363, let's prioritize this one
super low :p
aiui it s a display issue, but there might be tools that rely on that behavior somehow ?
Some tools might rely on that though
pinged cleanup crew
it's also a regression
ok just so you know, i ll probably use our decision in my documentation about prioritisation
anyway I guess this is low too
would say P-low anyway
thoughts?
I’d go for P-low until we have any complaints from tools maintainers
Beta nominations

1. No team assigned
    - Add T-compiler tag when it corresponds.
empty

1. All teams
    - Add T-compiler tag when it corresponds.
there's one but already beta-accepted

1. T-compiler
    - Add these issues to the meeting agenda.
should be empty too :)
and it is
Stable nominations

1. No team assigned
    - Add T-compiler tag when it corresponds.
It’s good when everything goes as expected, right? x)
yep :)
that one is empty
yeah, given that the release is tomorrow I wouldn't expect too much here :)

1. All teams
    - Add T-compiler tag when it corresponds.
there's one but already stable-accepted

1. T-compiler
    - Add these issues to the meeting agenda.
if there's nothing in all there's nothing here :)
PR's waiting for our team

• PR's waiting for our team
    • Add them to the meeting agenda explaining what they are waiting for.
    • Explicitly nominate any that you think may be able to be resolved quickly in triage meeting.
there are 2 in disposition to merge
adding those to the meeting agenda
done
Critical and High priority issues

• P-critical T-compiler
    • Add a little summary to the agenda about how many we have and how many of those are unassigned.
    • If possible try to help to move them forward.
    • Consider to nominate them to discuss on the meeting.
there's one assigned to oli
(It's the only P-critical issue, which seems like a success to me that it's being resolved so soon)
noted that in the agenda
@Wesley Wiser yeah, this has a PR but also one good discussion is ... should this go into tomorrow's stable?
should we block until is fixed? what should we do?
No, I think we've missed the boat for this release.
(IMO)
cc @pnkfelix
let's continue meanwhile ...

• P-high T-compiler
    • Add a little summary to the agenda about how many we have and how many of those are unassigned.
    • If possible try to help to move them forward.
    • Consider some for nomination to discuss on the meeting.
When we marked it P-critical, it was with the hope it would be fixed soon but not necessarily before tomorrow.
yeah, true

Santiago Pastorino said:

  • P-high T-compiler
    • Add a little summary to the agenda about how many we have and how many of those are unassigned.
    • If possible try to help to move them forward.
    • Consider some for nomination to discuss on the meeting.

added this stuff to the agenda
given that the agenda doesn't seem to be very packed we may want to look for P-high issues to nominate for discussion
let's continue but if someone see something on P-high that may worth discussing please comment
Stable to beta regressions

• Stable-to-beta regressions (all! not just T-compiler)
    • Check if there are relevant issues that are worth raising awareness.
    • Assign if possible; if it remains unassigned, add it to agenda so we can assign during the meeting.
going to add stuff to the agenda
do we think there's some issue worth raising awareness?
nope
:+1:
added everything to the agenda
Stable to nightly regressions

• Stable-to-nightly regressions (all! not just T-compiler)
    • Check if there are relevant issues that are worth raising awareness.
    • Assign if possible; if it remains unassigned, add it to agenda so we can assign during the meeting.
added everything to the agenda
there's only 2 P-high assigned, one P-high is not assigned and the rest neither
#71344 is not assigned
maybe worth nominating? or we can just mention when we mention regressions that this P-high is not assigned
ok so aiui eddyb was mentionned 2 days ago, and he ll be here tomorrow, maybe we can ask them ?
added to the agenda that is not assigned
but yeah, in some way or another we are going to mention it
Stable to stable regressions

• Stable-to-stable regressions (all! not just T-compiler)
    • excluding things already prioritized.
69 issues, 24 unassigned
going to add this to the agenda

Santiago Pastorino said:

Wesley Wiser yeah, this has a PR but also one good discussion is ... should this go into tomorrow's stable?

(playing catch up here: I think the only question I can see regarding PR #71140 is whether it should be beta-nominated or not...)
And my answer sort of depends on when the nightly-to-beta promotion happens
namely, if PR #71140 lands before the promotion, then beta-nomination is pointless
exactly
maybe we can mention that tomorrow
so lets just let it sit
yeah I agree, we can mention it when we discuss it at the meeting tomorrow
because we will list the P-critical issues
I-nominated T-compiler

• I-nominated T-compiler
    • Do a sanity check on them.
    • Add them to the agenda.
    • Check I-nominated all-teams.
going to start adding items to the agenda
but we need to check all that's nominated
done
all are added to the agenda
Announcements

• Check the compiler calendar to see if there's an outstanding event to announce.
  • compiler-team to-announce
    • Add them to the meeting agenda.
one of the announcements is that the release is happening :)
we will have Compiler-team meeting: Standard library implementation ownership on friday
there are also 5 things to-announce on the compiler-team repo
I'm not sure I got this to-announce idea right
we would be announcing that there are some major changes proposals?
are the announcements in general related to that?
cc @simulacrum
got a link that explains what to announce means ?
yeah so the idea is to basically name-drop a bunch of links
we want t-compiler to be aware of ongoing major change proposals
I think the announcements time is a good time
yep :+1:
done
Toolstate

• Check toolstate for outstanding tool breakage.
    • Notify teams in the corresponding channels
given that the release is tomorrow, there should be no such breakage right now, right?
it shouldn't I guess :)
well miri is on build-fail
I think there's a PR pending
uhh there was this morning
#71343 ?
I was thinking of the one that fixed cargo and rls
@simulacrum, ideas?
unsure why did RalfJ r- that one
I'm not sure what #71343 is waiting on...
Yeah his comment doesn't make sense to me
I know we posted a preview of tomorrow's release. Did that include miri?
commented
I have no idea what happens in situations like this :)
Performance regressions
Check perf regressions.

Santiago Pastorino said:

I have no idea what happens in situations like this :)

I guess as part of T-release process they would do something about it :)
miri isn't a blocker for release
we don't gate on it shipping for beta/stable

Santiago Pastorino said:

Check perf regressions.

there's nothing new I see
do people see something that worth discussing?

given that the release is tomorrow, there should be no such breakage right now, right?

yep nothing is breaking because CI blocks if toolstate fails
ok, I guess this is all
I'm going to review some stuff and check out agenda again, left some comments and things not well shaped
btw, we need a bot to run these meetings, manually having to do this process is a pain :)
cc @LeSeulArtichaut :slight_smile:
but seriously, unsure if you @LeSeulArtichaut have checked something, I may get started coding this at some point :)

Santiago Pastorino said:

do people see something that worth discussing?

There is a regression in wf-projection-stress but there's a PR that's supposed to fix most of it. The rest looks like a lot of small-medium improvements :tada:
just gave another look at the agenda, it's almost final https://hackmd.io/sUmyIVXkSvmLzy7KKKjExg?view
@WG-prioritization please check it out
I need to revisit the nominations, there are nominations for T-lang that for now I left there but I need to properly read the issues
I meant, it may worth leaving those and mentioning just in case?
@Santiago Pastorino what should we do with #71441
Should we beta-nominate it for tomorrow’s meeting?
I'd just nominate this one for discussion
